feed.title: Category: picks | User group for Viennese rubyists

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
11/05 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the seventy-ninth edition:

Laura:
  • Ecrire - A blog engine for developers
  • Sysadmincasts - Don’t leave out the sysadmins! There’s screencasts for them too..
  • Nokogiri Cheatsheet - Working with Nokogiri made easy
Ben:
  • Neural Networks Hacker’s guide to Neural Networks
  • The CAP FAQ - A short FAQ which answers all your questions about the CAP theorem.
  • Kill all your Redis - Game Day Exercises at Stripe: Learning from kill -9
Floor:
  • TIS - Tetris clone in 4kb of JavaScript
  • tty - A simple progress bar gem, with a great Readme
  • GitHub’s code search use case - Where do you learn how to use a feature/gem/project, if not from its documentation?

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
10/29 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the seventy-eight edition:

Laura:
  • SQLFiddle - yep, it exists.
  • ColorHighlighter - The Sublime Text Color Highlighter package now supports SASS variables!
  • HTML Sanitizer - The new HTML Sanitizer in Rails 4.2
Floor:
  • the next best social media dashboard - easily check social sharings of an url
  • Phaser - create an HTML5 survival horror game in 6 steps with Phaser

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
10/22 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the seventy-seventh edition:

Laura:
  • Chartkick - Because charts make us swoon.
  • Runnable - Run your code online
  • Top 3 reasons why software projects fail - fresh from the gaslight blog
Floor:
  • top 5 BaRuCo talks - A BaRuCo wrap-up by a Ruby rookie. Good stuff if you weren’t there.
  • accept Bitcoin with Rails - I might even try and hack something together for the sektor5 drinks app
  • (Belayed) happy birthday, CSS! - an interview with Opera’s CTO Håkon Wium Lie, who published ‘Cascading HTML style sheets – a proposal’ twenty years ago.

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
10/15 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the seventy-sixth edition:

Laura:
  • Public Activity - Easy activity tracking for your models
  • Window Functions - Postgres Window functions explained
Floor:
  • Building a meme generator - Learn how to build a meme generator using Twilio MMS, Imgflip and Sinatra
  • ant colonies - Simulating the emergent behavior of ant colonies with Ruby

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
10/08 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks - or: what we think is worth sharing - every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the seventy-fifth edition:

Laura:
  • Student Developer Pack - If you’re a student, consider signing up for this awesome pack!
Floor:
  • fresh guides - Yay for new Rails Girls guides - 12 and 13 - by the hand of @chastell.
  • Papis blogs! - Michal Papis just started a blog for RVM. Which is great.
  • Rails Rumble - Registration for this year’s Rails Rumble has opened. Keep in mind that you’d have a place to work/hack from, might your team need it.
